Gallery | Gavi's Restaurant

Ida Gavi, 80, fills a bowl of soup inside Gavi's Restaurant in downtown Louisville on Thursday. Ida and husban Iosif, who passed away at 72, founded the Russian American restaurant in 1982 which has been serving a clientele largely consisting of attorneys, lawyers and police from it's location downtown near the courthouse. The restaurant announced that it will be closing at the year's end. Nov. 20, 2014

Gallery | Gavi's Restaurant

Buy Photo
Ida Gavi, 80, fills a bowl of soup inside Gavi's Restaurant in downtown Louisville on Thursday. Ida and husban Iosif, who passed away at 72, founded the Russian American restaurant in 1982 which has been serving a clientele largely consisting of attorneys, lawyers and police from it's location downtown near the courthouse. The restaurant announced that it will be closing at the year's end. Nov. 20, 2014  Alton Strupp/The Courier-Journal
Buy Photo
Fullscreen
Zina Gavi in the early days following the opening of Gavi's Restaurant in downtown Louisville.   Photo contributed by family
Fullscreen
A family portrait of the Gavi's inside Gavi's Restaurant years ago. Family patriarch and restaurant founder Joseph Gavi is pictured at far left.   Photo contributed by family
Fullscreen
Ida Gavi, left, is shown behind the counter in the early days of Gavi's Restaurant in downtown Louisville. Ida is 80-years-old today.   Photo contributed by family
Fullscreen
Ida Gavi, left, and husband Jospeh Gavi in the early days of Gavi's Restaurant in downtown Louisville. Joseph passed at the age of 72. Ida is 80-years-old today and still works in the family restaurant.  Photo contributed by family
Fullscreen
Zina Gavi in the early days following the opening of Gavi's Restaurant in downtown Louisville.  Photo contributed by family
Fullscreen
Ida Gavi prepares food in the early days of Gavi's Restaurant in downtown Louisville. Ida is 80-years-old today and still works daily in the family restaurant.   Photo contributed by family
Fullscreen
The Gavi's sit near the site of their first home constructed in Louisville after relocating from Russia.   Photo contributed by family
Fullscreen
Buy Photo
Long-time Gavi's Restaurant customer Bill Adams, an assistant Commonwealth attorney, shares a laugh with Zina Gavi at the check-out counter following his lunch Thursday. Adams started coming to the restaurant eight years ago and eats at the downtown location at least four-times-a-week. "It's a nice comfortable place to go," Adams said. "I rarely go anywhere else." Like many of the restaurant's customers Adams is sad to learn that it will be closing. "I'm just disappointed," Adams said. Nov. 20, 2014  Alton Strupp/The Courier-Journal
Buy Photo
Fullscreen
Buy Photo
Ida Gavi, 80, fills out an order slip from the front bar area inside Gavi's Restaurant in downtown Louisville on Thursday. Ida and husban Iosif, who passed away at 72, founded the Russian American restaurant in 1982 which has been serving a clientele largely consisting of attorneys, lawyers and police from it's location downtown near the courthouse. The restaurant announced that it will be closing at the year's end. Nov. 20, 2014  Alton Strupp/The Courier-Journal
Buy Photo
Fullscreen
Buy Photo
Ida Gavi, 80, right, prepares customer's orders Thursday inside Gavi's Restaurant. Customer Jason Dattilo, left, eats lunch in the family restaurant every day and knows the weekly menu schedule as well as his own address. Like many loyal customers, Dattilo was saddened to learn that the restaurant will be closing at he year's end. "It's a local treasure," Dattilo said. "It's going to be sad to lose them." Nov. 20, 2014  Alton Strupp/The Courier-Journal

Fullscreen
Buy Photo
Zina Gavi takes a phone call at the check out desk of Gavi's Restaurant where portraits of her father, and family patriarch, Iosif Gavi, hang on the wall. Iosif, who passed away at 72, and wife Ida founded the Russian American restaurant in 1982 which has been serving a clientele largely consisting of attorneys, lawyers and police from it's location downtown near the courthouse. The restaurant announced that it will be closing at the year's end. Nov. 20, 2014  Alton Strupp/The Courier-Journal

A plate of stuffed cabbage, mashed potatoes and kale Thursday at Gavi's Restaurant. Nov. 20, 2014  Alton Strupp/The Courier-Journal

Long-time Gavi's Restaurant customer Bill Adams, an assistant Commonwealth attorney, eats at the downtown location at least four-times-a-week. "It's a nice comfortable place to go," Adams said. "I rarely go anywhere else." Like many of the restaurant's customers Adams is sad to learn that it will be closing. "I'm just disappointed," Adams said. Nov. 20, 2014  Alton Strupp/The Courier-Journal

Fullscreen
Buy Photo
Zina Gavi, left, fills a drink order while attorney Skip Daleure reads The Courier-Journal with his lunch. Daleure, an attorney in Louisville for 36 years, has been dining in the Russian American restaurant since it opened in 1982. "I like the food. I like the people," Daleure said. "I'm just really surprised it's closing." Nov. 20, 2014  Alton Strupp/The Courier-Journal
Buy Photo
Fullscreen
Buy Photo
David Gavi, 36, right, cooks burgers while his grandmother Ida Gavi, 80, prepares other meals inside the cooking area at Gavi's Restaurant. David helped in the restaurant throughout his life and moved away for college. After his grandfather, Joseph Gavi, passed away, David returned to help with the family business. "It's not realy yet," David said in regard to the restaurant closing. "It's like a Dr. has given you 30 days to live. What are you going to do with it?" Nov. 20, 2014  , Alton Strupp/The Courier-Journal

Zina Gavi, left, and mother Ida Gavi, check out customers Thursday inside Gavi's Restaurant in downtown Louisville. Open since 1982, the family announced that it will be closing it's doors at the year's end. Nov. 20, 2014  Alton Strupp/The Courier-Journal
